Automating Processes by Workflows

07 Jun 2022 - 1 minute to read
The Altilia Flows Arfifact provides you to create a workflow.
    1. You can recognize that you are in the Flows view and in which of them you are working, by the indication provided in the header at the top left of the screen:

Before you Start

    1. Create Project as described in the chapter Creating and Managing Projects
    2. Create Connector as described in the chapter Exploring and Managing Connectors
    3. Create Knowledge Base as described in the chapter Creating and Managing Knowledge Bases
    4. Create Dataset as described in the chapter Creating, Configuring, Curating, and Managing Datasets

Create Flow

    1. In the Altilia Intelligent Automation™ app, click "Flow" on the left navigation bar. The Flow Artifact opens.
    2. Create a new workflow by clicking on "+ New Flow":
    1. Type name, description (optional) and click on “Create”:
    1. Your Flow is now saved. At the same time a pop-up message is displayed on the screen asking you if you want immediately to be redirected to the settings page of the newly created Flow. In this case click on “Yes” otherwise you can postpone it to a later time (by clicking “No”) and then access to the settings page as described in the paragraph Access into Flow.

Flow Information

Your Flows are available in the Flows Artifact of your Project, you can use the sorting and searching functionality to find it as described in the paragraph Sorting and Search Flow:
    1. Inside a Flow panel, several information regarding the created Flows are shown. From the top to the bottom at the left side of the panel you can find:
      • Flow Name: also clickable to edit it as described in Edit Flow,
      • Author: username of the owner,
      • Last modified: date of the last changes
      • Runs number of the Flow
    2. Also within the Flow panel, you can also find other two features at the upper right corner side, read also more about them in the paragraph Settings Flows:
      • Quick button: interchangeable button with other functions that you can set,
      • Three dots: to access, delete and archive the Connector
    3. Lastly, at the bottom right corner side is reported:
      • Flow status: indicates whether the workflow is active or not

Altilia Flows

Provide you the capability to create workflow.
    1. In the Flow Artifact, open Altilia Flows™ by clicking on the related icon of the desired workflow at top right of same panel:
    1. It’s also reachable by clicking the “Flows” button on top right of the screen of each section of the Flows Artifact. :

Creating a workflow by using a template

To create your workflows you can pick a template from a wide set of template workflows each aimed at solving a specific document processing problem. You can see and explore details of templates to select the template that provides you the right skill for your document processing need. When you choose a template, you have only to configure connectors to let it run in your environment and set-up triggers and/or scheduling to let it run when needed.

Creating Workflows by from-scratch Composition

Users can create datasets and assign to it documents available in a knowledge base. Users can configure labels referred to data recognized by ML models. To annotate documents using labels, users make use of Altilia Labels that currently allows annotation for three different types of task: classification, entity extraction, and object extraction.

Executing a workflow

Workflows run on the base of triggers (e.g. new documents come by the input connector) or on the base of schedules (e.g. every hour, every day). User can inspect all workflow executions. Each executions provide alerts about possible issues while running or about extracted data (e.g. data is recognized by skills under a given accuracy threshold).

Settings Flows

    1. In the Flows Artifact, set the quick button of your Flows panel so that the most frequently used icon appears to you by clicking the three dots icon in the upper right corner of each Flow panel.
    1. Pin the desidered icon in order to see it next to the left of the three dots icon. By default it’s set to “Open Workflows”, read more about it on the paragraph Access into Flow.
    1. Click the pin icon to the right of “Archive” to set it as a quick button for each Flow, read more about it on the paragraph Archive and Unarchive Flow
    1. Click the pin icon to the right of “Delete” to set it as a quick button for each Flow, read more about it on the paragraph Delete Flow

Edit Flow

    1. In the Flow Module, edit your Flow already created by clicking on the name at the top left of its panel:
    1. The drawer panel opens at the right of the screen enabling you to change name and description of the Flow:
    1. Overwrite them and click anywhere on the screen outside the drawer panel to apply the changes. A pop-up message is displayed as confirmation:

Flow Drawer Functionality

From the following drawer it’s also possible to use some features designed to speed up the navigation in the platform.
    1. Access in a Flow by clicking on the “Details” button on the bottom side of the drawer panel:
    1. Access in Flow tool by clicking on the “Workflows” button on the bottom side of the drawer panel:
    1. Archive a Flow by clicking on the “Archive” button on the bottom side of the drawer panel
    1. Remove a Flow by clicking on the “Delete” button on the bottom side of the drawer panel:

Flow Drawer Information

Inside the drawer panel on the right of the screen, are reported below information:
  • Collaborators - the username of the people who collaborated in the creation of the Flow,
  • Number of Runs and the datetime of the executions

Access into Flow

    1. In the Flows Artifact, access your Flow already created by clicking on the three dots icon in the upper right corner of desidered Flow panel and then on “Go to Workflow”:
    1. The page you are redirected to is the Overview Section which is described in paragraph Flow Overview Section

Flow Overview Section

In the Overview Section of the Flow Artifact, review the details of the created Flow:

Flow Overview Information

Below is the information of the selected Flow:
  • Owner - the username of the Flow creator;
  • Collaborators - the usernames of the connector collaborators;
  • Skyll Type - type of created skill;
  • Base On - type of base of the Flow;
  • Runs Number - total number of Flow works.

Flow Overview Schema

On the right side of the screen you can find the Flow Preview:

Flow Runs Section

Archive and Unarchive Flow

It gives the ability to archive connector without deleting them in case you are unsure of their usability.
    1. In the Flow Module, archive your Flow already created by clicking on the three dots at top right of its panel and then on “Archive”:
It’s also possible to archive a Flow by quick button as described in paragraphs Settings Flows or from the drawer panel as shown in Flow Drawer Functionality.

Unarchive Flow

The number of archived Flows are displayed at the top left of the current view as described in the paragraph Status Flow.
    1. To unarchive a Flow click on “Archived” at top left of the screen,
    1. From here you can activate again the desired Flow by clicking on the unarchived icon at top right of its panel:

Delete Flow

Note that deleted Flow will no longer be recoverable. If you are unsure about deleting it, please archive it as described in the Archive and Unarchive Flow chapter:
    1. In the Flows Module, delete your Flow already created by clicking on the three dots at top right of its panel and then on “Delete”:
    1. A pop-up message appears on the screen requesting double confirmation. Click on “Apply” if you are sure to delete the selected Flow, otherwise click on “Cancel”:
It’s also possible to delete a Flow by quick button as described in paragraphs Settings Flows or from the drawer panel as shown in Flow Drawer Functionality, or as reported in Delete Flow from Artifact.

Delete Flow from Artifact

    1. Inside the Flows Artifact on any Section, you are also able to delete the Flow by clicking on “Delete” button on top right of the screen

Status Flow

    1. In the Flows Module at the top left of the current view, a filter is available to display active and archived Flows. In parentheses is the count of Flows that are in that particular state. By default, the Flows with “Active” status are shown:
    1. Show only the archived Flows by clicking on “Archived”:
    1. Show all created Flows by clicking on “All”:

Sorting and Search Flow

In the Flows Module, sorting and search tools are available.
    1. By default, the “Last Modified” sorting is used but you can select also by “Name” or “Author”:
    1. Furthermore, if you want to search directly for the name of a Flow then you can do it using the search tool:
